+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward Renaissance era and earlier siege units.
Siegecraft
Trench Warfare
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward all siege units.
Trench Warfare
Forest Runners
+5 [ICON_Strength] Unit Combat Strength when fighting Barbarians. Double experience for recon units.
Forest Runners
Zoning
+2 [ICON_Housing] Housing in all cities with at least 1 specialty districts.
Zoning
+1 [ICON_Housing] Housing in all cities with at least 1 specialty districts.
+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity to all cities with at least 1 specialty districts.
+3 Loyalty per turn for cities with a garrisoned unit.
Accumulate 25% less war weariness than usual. Cities with a garrisoned unit get +6 Loyalty per turn.
[ICON_Governor] Governors provide +4 Loyalty per turn to their city.
[ICON_Governor] Governors provide +2 Loyalty per turn to their city, in addition to +1 Loyalty per turn for every level of the [ICON_Governor] Governor.
Rock Bands from other players may not enter your territory. -2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities in all of your cities with 10 or more [ICON_Citizen] Population.
+2 [ICON_Production] Production and +8 [ICON_Gold] Gold from all [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward walls.
+6 City [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength. +6 City [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength.
+1 Movement if starting turn in friendly territory. Newly trained Military Engineers gain 1 extra charge.
+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each Research Lab, Military Academy, Seaport, Coal Power Plant, Oil Power Plant, and Nuclear Power Plant.
Accumulate 25% less war weariness than usual. +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity for cities with a garrisoned unit.
[ICON_GOVERNOR] Governors provide +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity and +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing.

All Neighborhoods receive +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold. Neighborhoods also gain +3 Food [ICON_Food] and +1 Production [ICON_Production] if on Charming tile, which is increased to +4 Food [ICON_Food] and +2 Production [ICON_Production] if on Breathtaking tile.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward Renaissance era and earlier melee, anti-cavalry, and ranged units.
[ICON_Tourism] Tourism from other players is reduced by 30% versus your civilization.
When you reduce a player's Diplomatic Victory points in the World Congress, get 50% of your spent [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor back. +2 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per turn.
+6 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per turn.
All units gain +50% combat experience.
+2 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer points per turn. +2 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer points per turn for every Workshop.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward Ancient, Classical and Medieval era naval units.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward Industrial era and earlier naval units.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward all naval units, excluding Carriers.
+50% [ICON_Science] Science in cities with Holy Site district.[NEWLINE]BUT: -25% [ICON_Culture] Culture in all cities.

Start Inquisition with 1 charge. All Religious units gain +10 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength in Theological Combat within friendly territory.[NEWLINE]BUT: -25% [ICON_Science] Science in all cities.

All Civilizations not at war receive +100% [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from your Concerts.[NEWLINE]BUT: Units other than Rock Bands receive -75% [ICON_Production] Production for producing, and cost +200% [ICON_Gold] Gold for purchasing.
+30% [ICON_Production] Production toward city projects.[NEWLINE]BUT: -1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity and -6 Loyalty per turn in all cities.
+2 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per turn for each Broadcast Center.[NEWLINE]BUT: -25% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture in all cities.
Spies who steal a tech boost without being detected gain an extra boost. +1 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per turn for every Research Lab.
+100% Theater Square district adjacency bonuses. Stadiums and Aquatics Centers generate +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity.

Spies can choose from any possible promotion. Foreign [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes provide +2 [ICON_Production] Production for their cities, +3 [ICON_Science] Science and +1 [ICON_Production] Production to your cities.

Rock Bands can choose from any possible promotion. Foreign [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes provide +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith for their cities, +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to your cities.
All Religious units gain +5 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength in Theological Combat. All Warrior Monks gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.

[ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Ally or Suzerain's city provide +3 [ICON_Food] Food and +3 [ICON_Production] Production for both cities. Alliance Points with all allies increase by extra 0.25 per turn.
+0.8 [ICON_Production] Production per [ICON_Citizen] Population in cities with an established [ICON_Governor] Governor.
All units gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking. Accumulate 50% less war weariness than usual.
+30% Production toward Units.
+15% [ICON_GOLD] Gold in all cities with an established [ICON_Governor] Governor.
+20% Production toward Districts.

All Religious units gain +5 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength in Theological Combat. All Warrior Monks gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. +0.4 [ICON_Faith] Faith per [ICON_Citizen] Population in cities with an established [ICON_Governor] Governor.
+1 [ICON_Housing] Housing per every level of Walls.
+30% Influence Points per turn.
+1 [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person Point from Holy Site (Prophet), Campus (Scientist), and Theater Square (Writer) districts.
City growth rate is 15% higher. +2 [ICON_Food] Food in all cities.
Border expansion rate is 25% faster. +2 Loyalty per turn in all cities.
Bonus [ICON_Faith] Faith equal to 50% of [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for each combat unit killed (on Standard Speed).
Increases healing by +20 points within 1 tile of Holy Site district.
+50 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +50 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each Barbarian Outpost cleared. All units heal up to 100 points when they clear Barbarian Outpost.
+1 [ICON_Science] Science and +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith on Geothermal Fissure and Volcanic Soil.
+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold on Mines over Luxury and Bonus resources.
+2 [ICON_Production] Production on Marsh and Oasis.
+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith on Pastures.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_Science] Science on Fishing Boats.
+1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture on Plantations.
+30% [ICON_Production] Production toward districts in cities without specialty district. +5% [ICON_Production] Production toward districts in other cities.
+30% [ICON_Production] Production toward Ancient and Classical era military units. +5% [ICON_Production] Production toward other military units.
+20% [ICON_Production] Production toward Ancient and Classical era wonders. +5% [ICON_Production] Production toward other wonders.
Allows construction of Cathedrals (+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist point per turn, 1 slot for religious art).
Allows construction of Synagogues (+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, Bonus [ICON_Gold] Gold equal to adjacency bonus of Holy Site district).
Allows construction of Gurdwaras (+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +3 [ICON_Food] Food).
Allows construction of Meeting Houses (+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +3 [ICON_Production] Production).
Allows construction of Wats (+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +3 [ICON_Science] Science).
Allows construction of Pagodas (+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing).

Shrines and Temples provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to their intrinsic [ICON_Faith] Faith output. These yields are increased by +50% if city [ICON_CITIZEN] Population is 15 or higher, +50% if district has at least +4 adjacency bonus.
Wonders provide +8 [ICON_Faith] Faith. +1 Appeal to all tiles for cities with wonder.
+1 [ICON_Food] Food on Farms on Floodplains.

Can purchase Campus and Theater Square district buildings with [ICON_Faith] Faith. +1% [ICON_Gold] Gold for each follower in cities with Campus district. +1% [ICON_Faith] Faith for each follower in cities with a Theater Square district.

International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes provide +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to cities with Holy Site district, and extra +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every Holy Site district building. +30% [ICON_Production] Production toward Traders and Commercial Hub district buildings.
+100% [ICON_Faith] Faith and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relics. +1 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from every walls.
Allows purchasing Warrior Monks with [ICON_Faith] Faith. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith from Renaissance Walls and defensive improvements. Extra +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith if the city has a garrisoned unit.
+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity for each specialty district adjacent to Holy Site district.
+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith from each Holy Site and Theater Square district for each city following this Religion.
+1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith from each Campus and Commercial Hub district for each city following this Religion.
+6 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +6 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each City-States following this Religion.
+6 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +6 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each City-States following this Religion.
Combat units gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength within foreign cities that follow this Religion.
Combat units gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength within friendly cities that follow this Religion.
Religious units heal up to 20 points when they eliminate a unit.
Grants 1 Apostle when completing Holy Site district.
Culture Bomb adjacent tiles when completing Holy Site district. Cities start with this Religion if founded by a player following this Religion.
Religious pressure from cities is 50% stronger and spreads 50% further away.
Increases city garrison [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength by +5. Units defending within this city's territory get +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. Establishes in 2 turns.
Your other cities within 9 tiles gain +4 Loyalty per turn towards your civilization. +50% [ICON_Production] Production towards walls.
City cannot be put under siege. +50% [ICON_Production] Production towards support units.
Other cities within 9 tiles and not owned by you lose 4 Loyalty per turn.
While established in a City-State, provides a copy of its Luxury resources to you. +2 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per turn.
While established in a City-State, accumulate its Strategic resources. When suzerain, this rate is doubled. Alliance Points with all allies increase by extra 0.25 per turn.
Religious pressure from this city is 100% stronger. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for each specialty district in this city.
+10 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength in theological combat within this city. City ignores Religious pressure from Religions not founded by you.
Gain [ICON_FAITH] Faith equal to 25% of cost when completing buildings. +1% [ICON_Production] Production for each follower.
80% resource discount for training units. Improved Strategic resources in this city accumulate extra +1 per turn.

This cityâ€™s improvements, buildings, and districts cannot be damaged by natural disasters. All Builders and Military Engineers trained in this city ignore [ICON_Movement] Movement cost of terrain and features.
+50% [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People points per turn in this city.
